Finding Items by Field Content

You can search all items displayed in the upper pane for the data contained in any displayed field. For example, you can locate a change request by its number or search for a file with a particular name, status, time stamp, or size.

If you want to search a field that is not displayed, double-click a column header in the upper pane, select Show Fields from the context menu, select the desired field, and click Add.

To find items:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select a component tab from the upper pane.

  3. Select Find from the component or context menu. The Find dialog opens.

  4. Enter part or all of the data in the Search for text box. Do not use wild cards.

  5. Select Forward to search the upper pane from the top to the bottom or select Backward to search the upper pane from the bottom to the top.

  6. Select Starting at: Currently selected item to begin searching from the item that is presently selected or select First item to search from the first item in the upper pane.

  7. Select either All displayed fields or This field. If you select This field, select the field for which you want to search from the drop-down list box.

  8. Select the Match case text box, depending on whether a case-sensitive search is appropriate.

  9. Click OK to search.

Tip: Use the following shortcut keys: Ctrl + F to start a search. F3 to find the next item that matches the search text. Shift + F3 to find the previous item that matches the search text.
